item.title: Is Dial-Up Internet Doomed?
item.description:
Dial-up internet, once the king of online connectivity, is facing an uncertain future in a world dominated by broadband. With various technologies like WiFi, DSL, satellite, cable, fiber, and cellular competing for users, the relevance of the once-groundbreaking 56K dial-up is questionable. It might be surprising to learn that millions of people in the U.S. still use dial-up. These users fall into two groups: those who would switch to broadband if it were affordable and those who use the internet so infrequently that they prefer a free option...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/is-dial-up-internet-doomed/
